articles.description: Live coverage from Bellator 298 in Sioux Falls as Logan Storley faces Brennan Ward.
articles.title: Bellator MMA - Bellator 298

articles.description: England must face Colombia in the Women's World Cup quarter-final without suspended top-scorer Lauren James, but they have a plan according to manager Sarina Wiegman.
articles.title: England have Colombia plan without James - Wiegman

articles.description: Erling Haaland scores twice as Premier League champions Manchester City start off their title defence with victory at Burnley.
articles.title: Haaland scores twice as Man City beat Burnley

articles.description: Liverpool agree a British record transfer fee of £111m with Brighton for Ecuador midfielder Moises Caicedo.
articles.title: Liverpool agree £111m fee with Brighton for Caicedo

articles.description: A stunning catch from Ross Whiteley helps Oval Invincibles edge out Northern Superchargers in The Hundred men's competition.
articles.title: Stunning Whiteley catch helps Invincibles stretch lead at top

articles.description: England captain Harry Kane is set to have a medical at Bayern Munich after being given permission to travel to Germany by Tottenham.
articles.title: Tottenham's Kane to have Bayern medical

articles.description: Watch the plays of the day from Headingley in The Hundred after two matches between Oval Invincibles and Northern Superchargers in the men's and women's competitions.
articles.title: Whiteley's 'stunning' catch leads plays of the day

articles.description: Manchester City midfielder Kevin de Bruyne "will be out for a while" after going off injured against Burnley, says boss Pep Guardiola.
articles.title: De Bruyne 'out for a while' with hamstring injury

articles.description: Great Britain's Ben Wiggins says he "backed up the hype" by winning silver at the Cycling World Championships in Scotland on Friday.
articles.title: Wiggins 'backs up the hype' with Worlds silver

articles.description: Manchester City head coach Pep Guardiola says he is "not frustrated" with Erling Haaland after the pair appeared to have a heated exchange at half-time in his side's 3-0 win against Burnley.
articles.title: I'm not frustrated with Haaland - Guardiola
